definition: to appear/to come out in the open
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Diazinon and chlorpyrifos, too, were eventually revealed to be hazardous.
sentences.chinese: 二嗪农和毒死蜱也逐渐显露出危险性。
我不能把恐惧显露出来。

sentences.english: Even as a child he showed an unusual aptitude for mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 甚至孩童时他就显露出非统一般的数学才能。

sentences.english: This tax inspector was demonstrating one of the most common of human frailties .
sentences.chinese: 这位稽查员，显露出一种最常见到的人性的弱点。

sentences.english: Only when doing things alone can he show his paces.
sentences.chinese: 只有单干的时候他才能显露出自己的真本事。

sentences.english: Stay calm and avoid the appearance of hostility or personal rejection.
sentences.chinese: 保持沉著和避免显露出敌视或个人的鄙弃。

sentences.english: His silence threw out his real intention.
sentences.chinese: 他的沉默显露出了他的真实意图。

sentences.english: For those who are saved and washed by His blood, faith will become sight.
sentences.chinese: 对这些得救且用宝血洗过的人，信仰会显露出来。

sentences.english: He says that he hasn't ever shown his paces.
sentences.chinese: 他说他从来没有显露出自己的真本事。

sentences.english: He keeps back the streams from flowing, and makes the secret things come out into the light.
sentences.chinese: 他封闭水不得滴流，使隐藏的物显露出来。

sentences.english: The clouds that comprise the Southern Equatorial Belt were gone when Jupiter emerged from its hiding place behind the sun last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月在木星从太阳背后隐藏处显露出来的时候。

sentences.english: She was beginning to show a little edge, but she obviously still could drive.
sentences.chinese: 她开始显露出几分醉意了，但很明显她还能开车。

sentences.english: He paused and suddenly all the frailty and fatigue showed.
sentences.chinese: 他顿住了，虚弱与疲惫一下子显露出来。

sentences.english: Roads had appeared again and gradually I saw that there was a town.
sentences.chinese: 公路再次显露出来，小城的轮廓渐渐明晰。

sentences.english: Daylight disclosed a chain of lakes and rivers in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 晨曦中显露出远处一连串的江河湖泊。

sentences.english: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
sentences.chinese: 他封闭水不得滴流，使隐藏的物显露出来。

definition: to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to take off (one's clothes)/(fig.) to shed (one's former image etc)/(of a fad or the after-effects of a disaster etc) to subside/also pr. [tun4 qu4]
to show in full light/to be revealed in its entirety
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
to lay bare/to come to light
